intro: Hieracium bracteosissimum, commonly known as the bracteose hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small yellow flowers in clusters. Hieracium bracteosissimum is often found in disturbed soils and can be an invasive species in certain regions.
